properties.value: A bounty crate was an item that contained an assortment of supplies that are commonly used in player killing activities. In order to purchase it from the Bounty Hunter Shop for 7 Bounty Hunter points, players required a combat level of 50. In addition, ironmen must have had the requirements to obtain the item for themselves. If the crate rolled an item the player did not meet the requirements for, a lower-level item was rolled instead. Ironmen were also unable to obtain Mysterious Emblems from the crate. It is unknown how this affected the probabilities of rolling the other items.

content:
Bounty crate was removed after an update.
As the contents of this page no longer exist in Old School RuneScape, this article is preserved for historical purposes.
Bounty crate

Item ID24329

A bounty crate was an item that contained an assortment of supplies that are commonly used in player killing activities. In order to purchase it from the Bounty Hunter Shop for 7 Bounty Hunter points, players required a combat level of 50. In addition, ironmen must have had the requirements to obtain the item for themselves. If the crate rolled an item the player did not meet the requirements for, a lower-level item was rolled instead. Ironmen were also unable to obtain Mysterious Emblems from the crate. It is unknown how this affected the probabilities of rolling the other items.

Players could buy up to a maximum of five crates, and could purchase an additional five for every target killed in Bounty Hunter.

Contents

  • 1 Loot
    • 1.1 Tertiary
  • 2 Changes
  • 3 References

Loot[edit | edit source]

Estimated drop rates are based off 5,000 crates.

The average bounty crate was worth 206,499.

Changes[edit | edit source]

Date Changes
21 November 2019
(update)

Ironmen can now buy Bounty Hunter crates, limiting supplies to items players can obtain for themselves. The crates will still contain Death and Blood runes, but Mysterious Emblems are entirely unavailable.

14 November 2019
(update)
  • The price of Bounty Hunter crates has increased from 5 to 7 points, and players now must have a combat level of 50 to purchase them.
  • A buy limit of five crates has been added; every target kill will allow five more to be purchased.
10 November 2019
 Hotfix

Bounty Hunter crates are temporarily unavailable for purchase from the shop due to excessive farming in the minigame.[1]

References[edit | edit source]

  1. ^ Jagex. Old School RuneScape's Twitter account. 11 November 2019. (Archived from the original on 27 May 2020.) Old School RuneScape: "Update: Bounty Hunter crates are temporarily unavailable for purchase from the shop. In the next update or two we hope to offer a more suitable version that’ll be less vulnerable to farming. We apologise for any inconvenience this may cause."
